#### Poster Presentations

**AAAS S-STEM Scholars Meeting** — San Diego, CA\
**Dates:** October 2–4, 2025 · **Theme:** Social Science\
**Title:** *Examining the Impact of an AI-Powered Writing Platform in Upper-Division Engineering Courses*\
[View poster](media/poster2.pdf)

**Expanded analysis across multi-quarter:** 

- Total AI interactions are a modest predictor of outcomes.\
- Instructional context and module design explain more variance.\
- Planning and revision modules are consistent student needs.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

**UCI Undergraduate Research Symposium — Poster Finalist** — Irvine, CA\
**Date:** May 16, 2025 · **Theme:** Human Experience and Expression\
**Title:** *Examining the Impact of an AI-Powered Writing Platform in Upper-Division Engineering Courses*\
[View poster](media/Poster.pdf)

**Initial findings (Spring 2024 cohort):** 

- Higher-performing students engaged more frequently and wrote more concisely.\
- Lower-performing students engaged less often but provided longer, more elaborate inputs per conversation.

Advisor: Dr. Mark Warschauer

-   **PapyrusAI (Jan 2025–Present):**\
    Data cleaning, exploratory analysis, and usage-pattern evaluation for an AI writing support system used across multiple course offerings and student populations.

-   **Converse to Learn (Jun 2024– Aug 2025):**\
